goodsky
Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
  goodsky.GameObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>

The GameObject holds all information about objects that you want to move around on the screen.

Method Detail

destroy

public final void destroy()
Dispose of your Game Object the humane way. If you do not use this function then your game object will not be deleted.

setImage

public final void setImage(java.lang.String filename)
Set the image of the Game Object.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the image file that you wish to set the image to. Ex. "smile.png" or "media/tree.jpg"

setAnimatedImage

public final void setAnimatedImage(java.lang.String filename,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   int frames)
Load in a string of images to make an animated image! This will load in the designated number of frames from the file, this command expects the frames of the image to be vertical, with the first on the top and then scans down to gather the rest of the frames.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the image file you want to load the image from
width - width of each frame in the image
height - height of each frame in the image
frames - number of frames

setShape

public final void setShape(int shape,
                           int size,
                           java.awt.Color c)
If you don't want/need to use a file image for a GameObject you can alternatively just set its shape.

Parameters:
shape - the shape of the object. ex. GameObject.CIRCLE
size - the size (in pixels) you want the shape to be

setShape

public final void setShape(int shape,
                           int size)
Alternative version of setting the shape without color

Parameters:
shape - Shape e.g. GameObject.CIRCLE
size - Size of object in pixels

getImage

protected final java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
This protected function returns the adjusted image.

Returns:
the adjusted image

updateBound

protected final void updateBound()
Protected function updates the bounding box around the object. This neat little function is used by both collision and for creating my transformed BufferedImage

setBoundingBox

public final void setBoundingBox(int width,
                                 int height)
This function will set the bounding box used for collision to constant values. The box is centered at the very center of the image. NOTE: when you use this command you will set the box to be static, the default bounding box changes as you rotate the image.

Parameters:
width - the TOTAL width of the bounding box
height - the TOTAL height of the bounding box

width

public final int width()
Get the width of the object (according to the collision bounding box)

Returns:
width of the object

height

public final int height()
Get the height of the object (according to the collision bounding box)

Returns:
height of the object

radius

public final int radius()

isOverlap

public final boolean isOverlap(GameObject obj,
                               int type)
Returns if the two objects are overlapping.

Parameters:
obj - the object to check if you are overlapping.
type - the style of collision checking to use. GameObject.COL_BOX - collision box GameObject.COL_CIRCLE - collision circles GameObject.COL_PIXEL - collision with pixel perfection
Returns:
true if they are overlapping. false if they are not.

isOverlapPoint

public final boolean isOverlapPoint(int posx,
                                    int posy,
                                    int type)
This is a MUCH FASTER method of finding collisions. Instead of checking for two sprite images colliding, we just see if a pixel is colliding with this object.

Parameters:
posx - the x position on the screen where you want to check for collision
posy - the y position on the screen where you want to check for collision
type - the style of collision checking to use. GameObject.COL_BOX - collision box GameObject.COL_CIRCLE - collision circles GameObject.COL_PIXEL - collision with pixel perfection
Returns:
true if they are overlapping. false if they are not.

setCollisionOn

public final void setCollisionOn(boolean onOff)
This function will turn collision on or off for this object. Collision by default is OFF. You must set any object you want to be 'collidable' to on if you want to use the collision commands.

Parameters:
onOff - True sets collision on; False sets collisions off

setCollisionGroup

public final void setCollisionGroup(int group)
Use this method to set the collision group that this object is in. Objects can currently only be in a single collision group. Use this with the group collision functions to check for specific object collisions. -1 is the default group.

Parameters:
group - the group id (any number you want)

moveCollisionCircleGroup

public final boolean moveCollisionCircleGroup(double dx,
                                              double dy,
                                              double radius,
                                              int group)
Try to move the object the amount specified in the x and y direction with a circle collision bound. If a collision occurs then the object will move as close as it can to the object. This function only checks against objects in the particular group NOTE: This works best with small movements (i.e. keyboard movement).

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
group - the group you are checking against
Returns:
true if a collision occurs, false otherwise

moveCollisionCircle

public final boolean moveCollisionCircle(double dx,
                                         double dy,
                                         double radius)
Try to move the object the amount specified in the x and y direction with a circle collision bound. If a collision occurs then the object will move as close as it can to the object. NOTE: This works best with small movements (i.e. keyboard movement).

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
Returns:
true if a collision occurs, false otherwise

setMaxClimableSlop

public final void setMaxClimableSlop(double slopeY)
Set the max slope that this object can go up when using sliding collision (between 0.0 [flat] and 1.0 [vertical])

Parameters:
slopeY - The slope amount between 0.0 and 1.0.

slideCollisionCircleGroup

public final boolean slideCollisionCircleGroup(double dx,
                                               double dy,
                                               double radius,
                                               int group)
Try to move the object the amount specified in the x and y direction with a circle collision bound. If a collision occurs then the object will slide along the collision normal NOTE: This works best with small movements (i.e. keyboard movement).

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
group - the group you want to check for collision against
Returns:
true if a collision occurs, false otherwise

slideCollisionCircle

public final boolean slideCollisionCircle(double dx,
                                          double dy,
                                          double radius)
Try to move the object the amount specified in the x and y direction with a circle collision bound. If a collision occurs then the object will slide along the collision normal NOTE: This works best with small movements (i.e. keyboard movement).

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
Returns:
true if a collision occurs, false otherwise

castCollisionCircleGroup

public final boolean castCollisionCircleGroup(double dx,
                                              double dy,
                                              double radius,
                                              int group)
Returns if there is a collision at the hypothetical dx and dy without actually moving the object.

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
group - the group you wish to check for collisions against
Returns:
true if there is a collision, false otherwise

castCollisionCircle

public final boolean castCollisionCircle(double dx,
                                         double dy,
                                         double radius)
Returns if there is a collision at the hypothetical dx and dy without actually moving the object.

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
radius - radius you wish to use around the object
Returns:
true if there is a collision, false otherwise

castCollisionLineGroup

public final double castCollisionLineGroup(double dx,
                                           double dy,
                                           int group)
Casts a line out of the object from the origin to the position (x + dx, y + dy), returns if there is a collision. If there is a collision it will return the distance to the collision. If there is no collision it will return a negative number. This is a good method to use for checking if projectiles hit.

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
group - the group you wish to check against
Returns:
the distance to the collision, or a negative number if there is no collision

castCollisionLine

public final double castCollisionLine(double dx,
                                      double dy)
Casts a line out of the object from the origin to the position (x + dx, y + dy), returns if there is a collision. If there is a collision it will return the distance to the collision. If there is no collision it will return a negative number. This is a good method to use for checking if projectiles hit.

Parameters:
dx - amount to move in the x direction
dy - amount to move in the y direction
Returns:
the distance to the collision, or a negative number if there is no collision

scale

public final void scale(double x,
                        double y)
Scale the GameObject's image. 1.0 is 100% (regular size). So twice the size would be 2.0.

Parameters:
x - xScale
y - yScale

scale

public final void scale(double s)

rotate

public final void rotate(double ang)
Rotate the image by the amount 'ang' in degrees

Parameters:
ang - the angle to rotate the object to

position

public final void position(double x,
                           double y)
Set the position of the game object NOTE: (0,0) is in the top left of the screen.

Parameters:
x - x position of the game object.
y - y position of the game object.

setFrame

public final void setFrame(int frame)
Set the current frame of the image.

Parameters:
frame - the frame to set the image to

animate

public final void animate(boolean onoff)
Turn animation on or off on a particular object.

Parameters:
onoff - true if you want it to animate. false if you want it to stop animating.

setAnimationSpeed

public final void setAnimationSpeed(double framedelay)
Set the speed of the animation. The argument 'framedelay' measures the number of seconds between each frame. So if you want a half second delay between each frame switch put in 0.5.

Parameters:
framedelay - The delay (in seconds) between each frame switch when animated.

getFrame

public final int getFrame()
Get the frame that the image is currently on.

Returns:
the frame we are on.

getXScale

public final double getXScale()
Get the X Scale of the object

Returns:
X Scale (e.g. 100% scale is 1.0, twice the size would be 2.0)

getYScale

public final double getYScale()
Get the Y Scale of the object

Returns:
Y Scale (e.g. 100% scale is 1.0, twice the size would be 2.0)

getAngle

public final double getAngle()
Get the angle the object is currently facing in degrees

Returns:
angle in degrees

setDepth

public final void setDepth(int z)
Set the render depth. Lower depth GameObjects will be IN FRONT. default depth is 10

Parameters:
z: - the depth for the game object

compareTo

public final int compareTo(GameObject o)
Compares the depth of two GameObjects. This is used internally, not necessary for users.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
Parameters:
o -
Returns:
positive if the comparator object goes before 'o', negative otherwise. 0 for a tie.

public java.lang.String toString()
